names.pinyin: dang gui yang xue tang jia wei

actions: With Bai Zhu, for Spleen Qi Deficiency with weakness, lassitude and loose stools.
Tonifies, invigorates and harmonizes the Blood and and regulates the menses.
With Huang Qi, for Qi and Blood Deficiency.
With Shu Di Huang, for Heat symptoms due to Yin Deficiency and Devastated Blood.
With Gan Cao, moderates spasms and relieves abdominal pain.
Tonifies the Liver and Kidneys, nourishes the Blood and nourishes Jing.
Nourishes Jing and Blood, fills the Marrow, and nourishes Liver and Kidney Yin.
With Dang Gui, for Blood Deficiency marked by dizziness, palpitations, insomnia and menstrual dysfunction.
Harmonizes the transportive and transformative functions of the Middle Jiao to treat anorexia, distention, fullness, lethargy, spontaneous sweating and a restless fetus.
Regulates Qi, adjusts the Middle, relieves the diaphragm, dries Dampness and transforms Phlegm.
With Bai Zhu, for anorexia and other symptoms of Damp Obstruction due to Spleen Deficiency.
Tonifies the Spleen, augments Qi, moderates and harmonizes the harsh properties of other herbs and guides the herbs to all twelve channels.
Strengthens the Liver and the Kidneys

manifestations.pulse: Choppy or Fine or Thin and soft
